description:
Positive base tax amount/allocated share

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
73511 Trade tax statistics

Definition:
The base tax amount is calculated by applying a nationwide
basic tax rate of 3.5 percent to the rounded-off business
profits minus a tax-free allowance. The basic tax rate for
home traders and people of equal status is 1.96 percent. If
a business maintains establishments in various
municipalities, an establishment extends across several
municipalities, or an establishment relocates to another
municipality during the period for which tax is collected,
the base tax amount is divided among the municipalities that
have the right to impose the tax. The municipality with the
right to impose the tax stipulates the trade tax assessment
rate. The annual tax due from the business is established by
applying this assessment rate to the base tax amount (or to
the municipality's allocated share) (Section 16 of the Trade
Tax Act).
